bullets.text: Built and shipped backend APIs for a workflow automation product, focusing on reliability and clear versioning.
Implemented request validation, structured logging, and standardized error responses to improve debuggability.
Designed data models and migrations for a Postgres datastore, adding indexes and constraints for correctness.
Added background job processing for long-running tasks, improving responsiveness for end users.
Introduced caching for frequently accessed endpoints and tuned pagination for large result sets.
Built a small internal dashboard to monitor job throughput, retries, and failure reasons in production.
Improved CI pipelines with linting, unit tests, and build artifacts, reducing broken merges.
Wrote integration tests for key API flows and added contract checks for critical endpoints.
Collaborated with frontend engineers to define stable API schemas and reduce breaking changes.
Implemented role-based access control checks and audit trails for administrative actions.
Tracked performance regressions using basic profiling and improved latency on slow endpoints.
Created developer documentation (setup, runbooks, API examples) to speed up onboarding.
Helped triage production incidents by analyzing logs/metrics and proposing fixes with clear postmortems.
Refactored a monolithic module into smaller services with clearer boundaries and improved testability.
Contributed to an internal release checklist and improved deployment safety with preflight checks.
Built a full-stack document search app with semantic retrieval, combining a Python API and a React UI.
Implemented ingestion pipelines (chunking, metadata extraction, deduping) to prepare documents for indexing.
Added embedding-based search and hybrid ranking (keyword + semantic) to improve result quality.
Created an evaluation harness with labeled queries and metrics (precision@k, recall@k) for ranking iteration.
Built a query UI with filters, highlights, and saved searches, optimized for fast navigation through results.
Implemented authentication and per-collection access control to support multi-user usage.
Added background re-indexing jobs with progress reporting and safe retries on failures.
Instrumented latency and error-rate dashboards and added alerting for index health.
Deployed with Docker and automated CI checks (tests, lint, build) on every pull request.
Implemented exportable result reports for sharing and reproducible investigations.
Added prompt-safe summaries of search results with strict truncation and citations to source snippets.
Optimized throughput with batching and caching, reducing repeated embedding calls for identical inputs.
Built a simulation framework to model request traffic, retries, and cascading failures in microservice graphs.
Implemented configurable latency distributions, error injection, and circuit breaker policies.
Computed SLO-style metrics (availability, tail latency, error budgets) over simulated runs.
Ran parameter sweeps to compare mitigation strategies and summarized outcomes in repeatable reports.
Added a lightweight visualization module for timelines and dependency bottlenecks.
Packaged the tool as a CLI with configuration files, enabling reproducible experiments.
Implemented unit tests for stochastic components using fixed seeds and property-based assertions.
Documented common failure patterns and recommended operational guardrails based on experiments.
Trained a deep learning classifier to predict whether user-uploaded images meet quality thresholds for downstream processing.
Built a data pipeline for labeling and balancing classes (blurry, low-light, occluded, acceptable).
Applied transfer learning with augmentation and calibrated probability thresholds for high recall on low-quality images.
Added leakage checks and near-duplicate detection to keep train/validation splits clean.
Tracked experiments and compared models using F1 and ROC-AUC on a held-out set.
Implemented an inference script that batch-scores a folder and outputs per-image explanations and tags.
Profiled inference latency and introduced batching to improve throughput on consumer hardware.
Documented limitations and common failure cases, plus a plan for data collection improvements.
Packaged training/inference into a reproducible project structure with configuration-driven runs.
